runs.comm: on the pads, decent length, nudged away to launch the innings
flicked nonchalently through midwicket. Calm start from both batsmen
quicker delivery, pushed through from round the wicket. Strikes the pad but sliding down
premeditated sweep, well played but not quite timed. Fine leg chases and gathers
pushed through again, and that's the breakthrough! Lumb expected it to be tossed up, but instead Botha fired in another quicker one, it struck the pad before he could move, and that was plumb
good flight and massive tweak, but Pietersen got in a big stride and that appeal was always optimistic
a ripper. Just under 90mph, nipping away late from a tight line, and Kieswetter is beaten
now that's a response! Fractionally fuller, and it was all the invitation Kieswetter needed. Leaning onto the front foot, a full drive, and pierces the covers
on the pads, worked into the leg side
full and straight, and KP bludgeons that back down the ground! Sweet strike, full face of the bat, it was in the air but never close to a return catch. That was travelling
flicked ambitiously into the leg-side, but midwicket intercepts
stunning strike! A slower ball from Steyn, wide of off stump, and Pietersen climbed into like Steffi Graf on set point. Fraulein Forehand, match that!
lively lift outside off stump, but he oversteps and a free hit is coming up ...
Kieswetter backs away in anticipation, Morkel follows him, a wild swipe spirals out to square leg, and Duminy completes the non-catch
Pietersen stands his ground this time, and that's flogged majestically through midwicket. He's in the zone so far in this innings
worked into the covers
on the pads, an optimistic whip of the bat, but that takes the thigh-pad and deflects to fine leg
smeared down to third man, an easy catch, and Kieswetter walks ... but it's a no-ball! Nearly a run-out as they hustle through for a single, but that's a mighty let-off ... how costly will it be?
a free hit and Pietersen's eyes pop out on stalks as he nearly hoists himself off his own feet. But there's no contact
goodness me, it's all going wrong for South Africa, a genuine edge, and that flies straight between Kallis at first slip and Boucher with the gloves. And neither flinches!
good length to launch his spell. Defended
belted into the covers, that was middled once again, but straight at the fielder
clipped calmly to midwicket and an easy single
good length outside off stump, driven on the up to long-off
banged in short, too short for the batsman to reach it. And Boucher can't get there either!
made room, drilled into the covers. Can't quite time it
better length to finish the over. But another messy effort. South Africa are looking anxious out there
a premeditated charge but that length was too good, and the ball zips over the bails and through to the keeper
Pietersen steps inside the line, shovels a pull through square leg, using Morkel's natural bounce to help it round the corner. Excellent thinking, and great execution
fuller length, much fuller. Pietersen tried to work that through midwicket, but got a fat leading edge through the covers. They all count
that's some serious timing. Short and lifting, not a bad ball at all, but Pietersen walloped that through midwicket with a dismissive swat
a half-chance as KP swipes a good-length ball down to third man, but the outside edge drops just short of the fielder
low full toss, on leg stump, flicked to deep square. Eventful stuff!
humungous. Three steps down the track, a majestic hoist, and that landed ten rows back at long-off
full this time, an attempted flick, but no real contact
fuller length, almost a yorker, and only a thin inside-edge saved his stumps there. But KP is flinging the bat at everything
cheeky. Steps inside the line, down on one knee, dabs a paddle sweep over fine leg. And that's four more
zipping through at a good pace, just outside off. No contact on a wiped drive
crunching cut shot to complete the Powerplays, and that's emphatic. Stand-and-deliver stuff as the ball hurtles in front of square
decent length, a fraction short, pulled hard but tidied up at deep midwicket
lifting from a good length, tucked off the hip but without any power
full and straight, a hint of swing, this is more like it for South Africa
driven coolly into the gap in the covers
short and straight, and that's deemed okay on height as Kieswetter misses out on a pull
makes room, mows a drive to deep cover, that's a tidy start to his spell
punched back up the track, no great power
tossed up, clipped to short midwicket
calm single, down to long-off. KP comes on strike
high and wild, flogged out to deep cover, but there's no-one back on the rope, and he gets away with it
flicked firmly to midwicket, where a tumbling stop saves the single
there's the Red Bull run, but mid-on can't gather, and he's home safe. Decent over
good line and length, worked away for a single
Kieswetter made room, Kallis followed him. Good bowling
short-arm jab, through midwicket, but not really middled
full and fuller, and held back a touch. Defended with a bit of a late adjustment
right up to the bat, and pushed down to mid-off. This is tight and teasing bowling
punched down to long-on, where Morkel concedes a second run as he gathers slowly. Still, another excellent over to stem the run-flow
dropped! That is an absolute howler from JP Duminy at cow corner! A regulation mistimed pull, he had all the time in the world to steady himself, but failed horribly. Oh dear
KP escapes the strike
Kieswetter returns the compliment. Good bowling, and deserves better
worked round the corner for another single
cracked back to the bowler. Good teasing flight
another single from another good-length delivery. Five singles, and a dropped catch. Good over
Kieswetter is momentarily caught out by the sudden injection of pace, but his checked drive pierces the covers nonetheless
no such qualms for KP! A murderous mowed drive, makes room and crashes through the covers
slower delivery, too short, and that is belted high and handsome, onto the roof, and two bounces, off the corregated iron, and out of the ground!
another short ball, quicker this time, and KP's pull finds thin air
flamingo flick, up and over midwicket, finds the gap, and that's a spectacular half-century against arguably the best attack in the tournament. Only 30 deliveries, and the promise of much more ...
low full-toss, driven wholeheartedly to long-off, who fields on the second bounce
pushed through, flatter and quicker
and that's a deserved wicket for Botha. On the leg stump, an inside-out sweep, but he can't loft it over leg gully who gathers a simple spooned catch
pushed into the covers
pushed onto the back foot
looked for a scurried single but nothing doing. Another eventful over
attacking the top of off stump, it works in all formats. Defended
ambitious swing of the blade from a full length. No contact
full and straight again, mid-off gathers
bouncer, and a good one. Just passed within head height, so no wide
excellent length once again, a leading edge is smeared down to third man, who can't quite make the ground for the catch. Always safe
a shimmy down the track, and Collingwood dents Kallis's figures with a disdainful pull over deep midwicket. That's his shot, and it travelled!
too short, and that is walloped. A Collingwood-esque lofted pull over midwicket. Agricultural, but wonderfully timed
back on a good length, and defended
Kieswetter goes this time, charging into a lofted drive, but he got underneath the stroke a touch, for Steyn at long-on to backpedal into a well-judged catch
chopped out to short third man
looped up from round the wicket, punched back to the bowler
switch-sweep, and that's wonderfully placed. Pierces the gap at what used to be backward point. And goes for four
an uppish drive, out to point
that's a cracking strike. Three quick steps, a violent swing of the bat, and that's cleared long-on by a distance
low full-toss, chipped out to mid-on
stand-and-deliver from Collingwood, an eager swipe, a spiralling top-edge, and a simple take for Boucher. Still, he picked up the pace nicely for England
slightly erratic fielding in the slips, but all tidied up in the end
he negotiates his first delivery calmly enough
a hopeful drive, but not timed
tucked up by a tight line and late inswing, defended down to fine leg
crunched out to deep cover, a good sliding stop cuts off the four
down the leg-side and called wide, although Steyn thinks there was a deflection on that
no deflection on that one. Steyn's pumped up, but he's losing his line a touch, perhaps as a reaction to Morgan's prowess outside off
not so prolific in that shot! Eminently cuttable, but he cuts thin air
slower ball, half-stopped in the covers, but they come back for a second
great batting, just a touch too leg-sided, and that's whipped so fiercely past fine leg. Morkel didn't have far to move, but he was beaten to the rope
full and straight, and Wright has no answer to that delivery. Right up in the blockhole, and Langeveldt strikes on his return!
good bowling again, angling into the batsman, who is forced to defend
over-pitched but not terribly so. A measured drive into the covers to rotate the strike
tight again, attacking the pads and cramping Morgan for room
blockhole bowling, and that's really good work from Langeveldt. He is an excellent death bowler
wonderful work from Langeveldt. Another yorker, with a hint of inswing. Bresnan bats that back to the bowler. Two runs from the over, and South Africa have control right now
that'll help England's cause. Steyn fires in a pad-high full-toss, and Botha at deep midwicket can't intercept a firm clip
much better from Steyn. Slower ball, an offcutter, and defended
another slower ball, and Bresnan is beaten all ends up. Was making room for a mow, but never got close
up in the blockhole, chiselled out to deep cover. They come back for two
slower ball again, crunched out to the sweeper once again
tucked up on the pads, they hustle through as Morgan keeps the strike with a dab down into the crease. Not Steyn's best spell of recent times though ...

wonderful take from AB de Villiers, diving towards the rope at cow corner, and that's an invaluable breakthrough! Langeveldt pitched it up from round the wicket, Morgan's swipe held up in the wind, and England's finisher is finished!
run-out opportunity, but the batsman gets home in the end. But it's Langeveldt's tight lines that are inducing the panic
full length again, squeezed away for a single
bunted hard and straight, back down the ground, plugs just in front of long-off, but another excellent delivery
low full-toss, swung out to the deep, but can't pierce the field
priceless boundary as Langeveldt offers too much width, and Bresnan belts that handsomely through the covers. England needed that
cracked hard off the back foot, over the bowler's head, but cut off in the deep
a swing and a miss, but they gallop through for a single. A no-ball is called because Langeveldt wasn't in the circle. He's not amused by that call. A valuable extra ball for England
flicked out to midwicket, another single
good delivery, full and straight, and beats an ambitious mow. Bresnan goes, and England are pegged back yet further
slower ball, chipped down the ground, lands just short of long-off. They are kept to a single
superb. Yardy walks inside the line, and flicks an emphatic four through backward square
cracked out to extra cover. One more to the total, but that's a spirited comeback from South Africa
